It is a non-vascular plant characterized by its small, compact growth form and its ability to thrive in moist, shaded environments. The plant has a distinctive appearance with its dense, cushion-like structure composed of closely packed leaves. Amauropelta lumbricoides is often found in temperate regions, particularly in forest floors and rocky crevices, where it plays a role in soil stabilization and nutrient cycling.
